summary: Uterine cancer is a cancer that forms in tissues of the uterus. There are two main types: endometrial cancer, which begins in the cells lining the uterus, and uterine sarcoma, a rare, more aggressive cancer that begins in muscle or other tissues in the uterus.
risk_factors: Estrogen-only hormone replacement therapy (HRT) after menopause (for endometrial cancer)
Early menarche or late menopause (for endometrial cancer)
Tamoxifen use (for endometrial cancer and uterine sarcoma)
Family history of endometrial cancer (mother, sister, or daughter)
Past radiation therapy to the pelvis (for uterine sarcoma)
